text: The Greenskins of the Madmoonz tribe are entangled in a Skaven plot to destroy Clan Rictus. The notoriously lucky Tretch, however, is a master schemer himself and has uncovered the plot. Unable to move against the Council of Thirteen members behind the scheme, he is determined to make an example of the hapless Madmoonz. He advances on their underground lair in the far north, determined to take the skull of the tribal leader for himself as an emblem of his uncanny fortune.

Settra must have discovered Arkhan's quest for the Staff of Nagash, for he has gifted it to a Skaven warlord in return for the Liche King's destruction. Arkhan faces a desperate fight indeed, though if he succeeds, the staff will be his to wield at last!

Arkhan has located the Lizardmen responsible for looting Alcadizaar's tomb. They are attempting to resurrect the Nehekharan warrior-king themselves, denying Arkhan the soul he so desperately seeks to empower his ancient Tomb Blade. They know too much, they dare too much - this ends here!

The books, along with the Necromancer’s staff, have awoken the Black Pyramid. And so the carrion circle. The Tomb Kings have always lusted for power in life and especially in death. Settra comes, leading an undying alliance to wrest the pyramid from its creator’s most loyal servant. The Followers of Nagash raise their warriors even as the Black Pyramid climbs into the sky. The battle for its control is about to begin.

The five books are found. The Liche Priests begin the ultimate incantation, igniting the power within the stirring Black Pyramid. Nagash’s ultimate legacy is ripe for domination. However, the Arch-Necromancer’s greatest lackey, the Liche King, has deployed his legions and lieutenants to defend the master’s shrine. \\n\\nArkhan himself remains mysteriously absent… for now.

Khalida arrays her forces at a crossing on the Ash River. A large Undead army, led by the cursed Lahmian Vampires, marches west towards the Black Pyramid of Nagash, no doubt with nefarious intent. On the opposite bank of the river, the cavalry vanguard of the vampires marches to cross the river. The time is nigh. Asaph has her champion, and she shall have her vengeance!

Khatep and his retinue enter the pitch dark tomb, and in a stroke, the terrible truth is revealed. Before his army, a ravening horde of Beastmen stretches, ready to charge - and at their backs, the Priests of Nagash. Treachery! The trail of breadcrumbs… the false litany... the lure of redemption - it is all an elaborate deception, fiendishly wrought to tantalise him, to draw him to this place and to his destruction. As the pieces fall into place in Khatep’s mind, his outrage is consumed in the white heat of fury. The foul apostates will pay with their souls – as will their beast-kin thralls!

Settra arrives at the reliquary, only to encounter a combined force of Humans and Dwarfs preparing to desecrate the site and thieve away his sacred blade. For such an affront, their souls are forfeit!

Settra's force has located those in possession of the Crown of Nehekhara. Possibly thinking that the crown will protect them from the Imperishable’s unending wrath, they are hidden in a forested area, from which they believe a trap can be sprung. They are, of course, wrong.

Druchii under Morathi's dominion intercept the Blood Queen's retinue. Hellebron is unconcerned, for the time of murder is at hand, and for every enemy throat severed and dedicated to Khaine her twin blades will find their edge once more. Yet… this battle – like all the events leading up to it – is of Morathi's machinations. Nothing should be taken as it seems.

Secrecy and stealth are the Everqueen's allies as her war host seeks to take the higher ground and gain a key tactical advantage against the mortal servants of the Dark Gods. The enemy has placed his artillery forces on a hill to the east. How the Everqueen deals with them will be the key to unlocking victory.

Even though Alith Anar walks into this willingly, the battle is still a trap. The Shadow King must use all of Loec's tricks to evade capture and make the Dark Elves pay for this brazen and doomed act. Like the shadows the king and his warriors are named after, the Asur must remain evasive and not get pinned down, for that is when the Dark Elves might actually get the upper hand.

Glorious! The Beast of Raema is just as the legends proclaim - the creature's many heads will make perfect trophies and a worthy sacrifice to the Dark Gods. Its Beastmen acolytes bray with a madness you have not seen in the Cloven Ones before, so be wary when tackling them. But enough posturing - the hunt nears its end and there is a monster to slay!

Through the stinking, cramped tunnels you go and then finally you emerge at Seep-Gore, lair of the Hellbeast. The creature lumbers forward, its straining abdomen appearing to pulse as if barely constraining the hordes within its distended belly.\\n\\nThe monster is truly is an abomination! Its heads will make many trophies and a worthy dedication to the Dark Gods... Kill it!

Despite the Shifting Isles, you arrive in time, as the volcano growls. Assuming the snivelling Druchii told the truth, the Mother of the Flame will rise from Vaul's Anvil at any moment. Then, you see the High Elves deploy their Dragon Princes and Phoenix Guard - warriors sent to guard this mythical creature and a sure sign that this is indeed the right time.\\n\\nBreak them apart to claim victory. This bird will make a perfect sacrifice!

After endless days trudging through the jungle, your warband arrives at a great temple scattered with the bones of beasts and other prey. It is a feeding ground. You turn to ask the Skink if this is the place to bait a trap, but the reptile has gone! All that remains is a shackle containing a foot gnawed through at the ankle. It seems the trap is not yours to set - for you are the bait!\\n\\nA great roar rumbles across the clearing, the ground shakes, birds scatter from the lush canopies, and the usually-loud jungle is suddenly silent... until pierced by another roar. Then, from the trees, a chanting is heard "Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan! Gargantulzan!"\\n\\nThe behemoth has arrived, and you must now fight a Carnosaur of legend!

What started out as a hunt to punish some Norscans for murdering Manann's creatures has now become an emotionally-charged family affair. Aranessa may have been born Norscan, but her allegiance has always been to the sea. Rejected and betrayed by her own flesh and blood as a baby, she now has a chance to appease the bitterness raging eternally inside her.\\n\\nThe Skjold chieftain claiming to be her birth father has just launched a raid against Pack Ice Bay. Aranessa vows that no more innocent creatures of the sea shall die in her name – this ends now!

It has been many years since Madame Cylostra was the favoured court singer of Bretonnian royalty, a distinction she intends to have once more. Having spotted a galleon of Bretonnian troops disembarked on a nearby island, she has little time to waste. If she can get close enough, she will give them the show of a lifetime and remind them what they’ve been missing all these years!

All three verses of the Lost Sea Shanty have been discovered and sung, unleashing the Invocations of Potency hidden within the lyrics. At last, the Star-metal Harpoon now has the power to slay the Merwyrm known as Amanar, but there is one who has been following this ill-gotten quest since the beginning, one whose ship has been stalking yours from afar on the horizon; now you are poised to strike, he steps forward to claim the prize for himself.\\n\\nYou are merely interlopers, for the sea-beast allies itself to the High Elves, who are the mortal enemies of your stalker. Now your use is at an end, he will take the harpoon, kill the beast and revel in the infamy.\\n\\nThat is, of course, only if you let him…

The Lizardmen may have taken their enchanted gold back, but Luthor Harkon is already closing in. The wily pirate has spies all around the Vampire Coast's borders and on its outlying islets, so a Lizardmen army of such a vast size could not simply move around Lustria without him hearing of their whereabouts. He knows precisely where the gold is, and now it is his for the taking - anything that gets in his way will be swiftly dealt with, for death comes to all who oppose the Pirate King!

The map that came into Count Noctilus’ possession is no trap – it has led him to an unchartered island in the Great Ocean where the treasure chest containing Captain Roth’s Moondial is located. As he approaches the island, however, it appears his map is not the only one in existence – a large army of treasure-hunting soldiers of fortune has somehow found its way there ahead of him and pitched camp at the top of a hill. Before the day is out, Noctilus will surely have made yet more of the dead to raise into his Undead ranks!

While the Blessed Dread is docked, the Skaven strike! Their sorcerous leader believes they have weakened the Krakenlord, and while he licks his wounds and pride in port, the ratmen will take the spoils and infamy for themselves. But they could not be more wrong... they are not the hunters but the hunted! Fellheart knew the creature that cursed his helm would attempt an incursion here, so his crew lay in wait for the Skaven thieves to board. Afore the day is done, Fellheart shall sluice the decks in ratblood and restore the Helm of the Kraken to its former lustre!

There are few potential proponents of the Lizardmen’s cause more powerful than the venerable Lord Kroak, Deliverer of Itza. Said to have been taught the ways of the Winds of Magic by the Old One known as Tepok, the stoking of Kroak's relics into an active state will likely have a profound effect on the fulfilment of the Great Plan. Currently existing as a shrivelled and lifeless husk mummified in wrappings, some vestige of power still resides in him still, a distant echo of former glory, yet strength enough to unleash destruction upon his enemies. Yet now he sits vulnerable from the Skaven menace and must be protected at all costs.

Even during times of war, the Lizardmen are known for being cold, emotionless killers, but not Tehenhauin. As Sotek’s chosen, his sole purpose is to punish the Skaven, and he has done so with unrelenting zeal and brutality. Readying his apostles at Gwakmol Crater, the Prophet knows that whether or not victory is achieved, the path of the Prophet will not end there, for the Skaven and the Lizardmen are perennial - nay, eternal - enemies. The Winds carry whispers that these events may have unfolded before, and may yet unfold again. In any case, the Cult of Sotek have heeded the words of the Prophecy. Today, these ratmen must die – all of them!

Using his aerial mobility, Tiktaq'to has successfully tracked a large Skaven presence to a temple location where the Geomantic Web is emanating clear signs of deterioration.  Having already sent some of his squadron to reconnoitre the area, he knows the place to be crawling with the abominable ratmen, although it seems not all of them are immediately visible on the battlefield, at least from his elevated vantage point. There must be more of them around somewhere, ready to scurry out from their squalid burrows, but Tiktaq'to is unconcerned. For he is the peerless, fearless Master of Skies!

With the construction of his Warpstone Tractor Beam, Ikit Claw has really outdone himself. Needless to say, any plan involving the invention of a device to pull giant chunks of Warpstone down from orbit could only be thought up by an individual both deranged and brilliant in equal abundance. Whether or not Ikit will see his original plan through to the end and corrupt the Lizardmen’s spawning pools, he isn’t going to let any of the fallen Warpstone go to waste, and those pesky Lizard-things better not get in his way either. If they do, they will find themselves at the wrong end of his deadly Storm Daemon!

Lustria’s jungles burn. Its temple-cities crumble. Under Markus Wulfhart’s command, the Emperor’s forces have wreaked havoc in the New World, wantonly plundering the lucrative holdings of the lizard-beasts while sweeping aside all foes sent against them. But now, the most monstrous of them of all has been roused.\\n\\nWulfhart's scouts have informed him that the creature known as the Spirit of the Jungle has been sighted somewhere in the vicinity of Itza. The Huntsmarshal has caught the scent; this will be his toughest hunt yet.

One by one, Nakai fought off the so-called great hunters in cahoots with the Huntsmarshal. And one by one, they fled into the jungle like the warm-blooded cowards they are. Nakai correctly sensed they would be back for more, and now the chief warmblood himself, Markus Wulfhart, takes to the field with them. Lustria’s future hangs in the balance, for why else would Nakai be so compelled to act? This conflict ends now!

Itza is under siege. The ancient bastion is perhaps the toughest of the Lizardmen's temple-cities to penetrate for any attacker, but Luthor Harkon has already managed to breach its walls using his renowned eldritch artillery. His advance force of zombie crewmen are already closing in ahead of him, along with some pestiferous Skaven reinforcements. Nakai may not understand why these pathetic creatures seek to defile the sacred First City, but the Wanderer is nonetheless consumed by a simple, overwhelming urge to crush them all to a bloody, even-more-lifeless pulp.

On the rain-soaked marshes of Albion, Nakai primes himself for battle. A distant memory seems to linger in his primitive mind... a vague familiarity with his surroundings that the warmbloods might call 'déjà vu'. Had the Old Ones guided him to this place before in a previous era? As a Kroxigor Ancient, Nakai knows not his own age, nor does he really understand his purpose, but he is consumed by it. Whatever the Ancient Enemy are planning, Nakai knows the puppets they’ve sent to this sacred place must die immediately.

With the lifeless expressions of the slain settlers still fresh in his mind, the Huntsmarshal readies himself for some blood-soaked vengeance. His expedition had moved swiftly through the jungle with collective determination, hoping to prevent another catastrophe in the Lustrian colonies. This time, they were not too late. Markus was never one to take the merciless slaughter of his innocent kin very well, but had never let his anger overcome him on the battlefield before, and wasn’t going to now. These cold-blooded beasts will get the cold-blooded death that they deserve!

Gor-Rok’s arrival at Itza was a timely one. Luthor Harkon, the self-proclaimed king of the Vampire Coast, has somehow managed to wrangle together an eldritch army consisting not only of his rotting, Undead pirate crew, but also a cohort of verminous, screeching Skaven. Strongly sensing the danger, Gor-Rok positions himself within the great temple-city’s walls, undeterred by the approach of Harkon’s foul, rag-tag force. Whatever the insane Vampire has bribed the ratmen with, it’s likely that he plans to claim Itza’s powerful artefacts for himself, and will kill anything that gets in his way. There’s one thing he hadn’t counted on, however – the Great White Lizard is extremely hard to kill!

As Malus prepares to return to Naggaroth aboard his Black Ark it seems that Clan Eshin have other plans and have gathered to intercept him. The recent murderous attentions of the assassin-brood had not been as random and as senseless as they appeared – it is the Daemon they want, but they must know as well as Malus does that they are going to have to kill him to get it. Malus had heard of the ratman assassin Deathmaster Snikch, but now has the feeling that he may be about to get much more closely acquainted with him…

The mysterious power that Snikch has been sent after has turned out to be far more potent than he could have imagined. The Deathmaster might even consider the consequences of keeping it for himself – with such dark, powerful energies at his disposal, no being, mortal or otherwise, would be beyond the reach of his assassination attempts! Before that, however, Snikch still has to kill the Elf-thing who wields the Daemon before he can make a cowardly escape aboard his Black Ark…

To sate the thirst of the legendary Warpsword of Khaine, Malus must face the horrors that await him in the Chaos Wastes. All the while, his self-control waxes and wanes with the torment of Daemonic rage that bubbles within him. He was always arrogant and ambitious, even by Druchii standards, but his curse has convinced him that no foe can best him, and especially not today. The blade has already tasted Chaos-tainted blood – by the time the battle is over, it will be glutted with it!

Repanse has felt the Lady’s influence once again, ever guiding her towards the annihilation of the unholy evils of the world. Deep in the desert, beyond the Great Mortis Delta, priests of the dead have already started to ceremonially circumambulate the malevolent ebony symbol known as the Black Pyramid. Repanse regards the structure as no mere temple, but the very beating heart of the evil that blights these sand-strewn lands. The Tomb Kings’ purpose for it is unclear, but her gut instinct tells her that whatever the ritual being enacted, they must all be cut down.

Just off the coast of Repanse’s beloved home dukedom of Lyonesse, the Undead pirates of the sea gather and lurk. The most infamous eldritch admirals of the world have long been enticed to plunder the hoarded wealth of the Land of Chivalry, now consolidating their fleets to mount a massive invasion. There are two things the foul flotilla of creatures did not count on, however – the depth of Repanse’s unwavering piety, and her undeniable favour from the Lady, which shall surely propel her to victory once again!

Even far from home, Repanse continues to answer her divine calling, for the Lady of the Lake demands all Undead abominations be vanquished wherever they may be found. After a tough journey into the Atalan Mountains, the Chevaliers have made a timely arrival. The Dwarfs, though well accustomed to the struggle against the evils of the desert, find themselves in grave need of Repanse’s help. The Damoiselle de Guerre will oblige; after all, if the honourable do not fight shoulder-to-shoulder against the evils of the world, what chance do the forces of good have?

The ratling fool who thought he could get away with stealing from Snikch has been found, and must be moved upon before he can hightail it from his mountaintop hideout. Whatever the nature of the thief’s mysterious ally, they too will meet their end if they dare oppose Eshin's greatest Master Assassin. After all, the Cloak of Shadows is no two-bit garment for a low-life scrounger – it belongs on the back of the Deathmaster himself!

Brazenly challenged by a Blood Dragon Vampire, Imrik primes himself to fight for his ancestors’ honour. The Dragon Prince’s scouts have scoured the deserted island chosen by the fiend to be the location of the battle. They report that even now, the Vampire dons the gauntlet that once belonged to Caledor the First. This affront to Imrik’s homeland must be met with annihilation, then, once the gauntlet is recovered, the Armour of Caledor will be fully ensorcelled once more.
Through its herald, you have issued a challenge of battle to Shackolot the Calamity. The ancient Black Dragon and its attendants shall fight without mercy to test our strength!
Through its herald, you have issued a challenge of battle to Bruwor, Protector of Life. The ancient Forest Dragon and its attendants shall fight without mercy to test our strength!
Through its herald, you have issued a challenge of battle to Lamoureux the Frozen Breath. The ancient Moon Dragon and its attendants shall fight without mercy to test our strength!
Through its herald, you have issued a challenge of battle to Ymwrath the Eternal. The ancient Star Dragon and its attendants shall fight without mercy to test our strength!
Through its herald, you have issued a challenge of battle to Gordinar, Champion of the Flame. The ancient Sun Dragon and its attendants shall fight without mercy to test our strength!

Grom marched through the Yvraine Plain where the Elves had made a futile stand against him all those years ago. This time, they cowered within Tor Yvresse. Grom found himself salivating – possibly because he hadn’t eaten in the last ten minutes, but mainly at the thought of conquering the pointy-‘eads great city at long last. Eltharion, the Elf-git who repelled his first invasion and beheaded his Shaman, would be waiting for him. Grom was going to chop him up and burn the city to the ground, just in time for dinner.

As Grom prepares to squish Git Guzzler like the puny runt he is, his scouts reveal that other unknown Night Goblins have been spotted nearby. Turns out this little soirée was all part of someone’s complex plan to stoke up Goblin rivalries, first by swapping Grom’s axe with a counterfeit, then by spreading rumours about a rival Goblin, Git Guzzler, to bring them both to battle.\\n\\nGrom is unmoved, however – whoever this rotten mastermind is, the Goblin King will smash all his rivals and end this battle royale, reclaiming his axe and proving once and for all that he is the biggest, bestest gobbo!

The goal of the heinous forces of Chaos is clear. They want the destruction of the ancient Waystones, an act that would leave Ulthuan exposed and disrupt the flow of the Winds of Magic into the Great Vortex. Not only would the Elves’ island-haven be overrun by Daemonic evil, but Chaos would eventually be able to manifest freely and unabated across the entire world. This is the Warden’s burden; he has no choice but to answer his calling and stop them at all costs.

As Eltharion reconnoitred Grom’s great horde from Tor Yvresse’s walls, his grip involuntarily tightened on his Fangsword. The city’s defence against the Goblin King’s insatiable attentions is his sworn duty, just as it was his father’s before him. But this was personal. He suddenly remembered that Grom’s first invasion had caused the deaths of his family members, his brother grislily hacked apart by the obese Goblin himself. Today, duty and vengeance would both be accomplished. There would be no escape for the Paunch.

Throt’s had suffered his extreme Black Hunger for too long. His successes in creating foul abominations were testament to the fact that his affliction had never made him any less of a Master Mutator, but the opportunity to finally cure his ravenous disposition was too good to pass up. The tree-thing informant had spoken the truth – a veritable demigoddess now stands vulnerable before him, conjuring some inconsequential spell. All that remains is to capture her, grind her into a pulp, and consume her!

Bloodthirsty Warriors of Chaos surround the fleshy walls of Hell Pit, nightmarish stronghold of Skaven Clan Moulder. Their frenzied presence at its corpse-adorned gates prevents fresh shipments of Rat-Ogres and other such abominations from reaching other clans. The rival Rat Lords have paid handsomely for these monstrous recruits – should Moulder fail to meet its obligations, the reprisals will be severe. As his greatest creation, the Rat-Ogre/man hybrid Ghoritch, has thus far failed to drive off the invading horde, Master Mutator Throt resolves to obliterate these servants of the Dark Gods himself.

Using relics stolen from across the Old World, Drycha must disrupt the Waystones which make up the fence around the Wildwood, thus shattering Ariel's powerful wards, magical protections designed to prevent anyone from breaking into the prison holding the Ancient Treeman Coeddil. The Wildwood Rangers have been alerted to her presence and have already moved to intercept her. Now, Drycha must battle her way through the wilderness to free the embittered Ancient from his leafy confinement.

Though the Great Vortex stifles Daemonkind, a rift in the Witchwood provides Chaos with another passageway into the world. Ariel, demigoddess of the Asrai and avatar of Isha, channels all her power to seal the portal, hoping to prevent the Daemons of the Dreaming Wood from entering the mortal plane. Somehow, the scheming Skaven know the Mage Queen is vulnerable, and are preparing to attack. The Sisters of Twilight must dispatch them before they can disrupt Ariel’s efforts and bring cataclysm to the world.

Naestra and Arahan approach Witchwood Hollow with caution. Though their Forest Dragon was purportedly taken alive, the involvement of the Beastmen is a cause of great concern for the twin maidens. Ceithin-Har is a powerful and majestic beast, more than capable of taking care of itself, but somehow it has been rendered vulnerable, likely by some Dark Magic. There is no doubt in the sisters’ minds that the foul Children of Chaos are up to some fell ritual, and that their Dragon companion is in great danger!

The place known as the Heart of the Dark is a destination never spoken of, but the way to the malignant monolith at its centre is always revealed to those who have the Dark Gods’ favour. Even their Ruinous plan to bring about another Coming of Chaos through the power of the mighty Herdstone matters little to the Brass Bull, for he wishes only to be given the power to rampage eternally and feed his perpetual Bloodgreed. Enemies abound as rivals also seek such power, while ancient foes stalk in the shadows.

Once a year, the Witch Elves descend onto the streets of their cities in unbridled celebration of murder – this is Death Night. Arriving on the city outskirts, the Brass Bull observes the blood-red smog emanating from the twisted mansions, a sight that heightens his bloodlust even more. The roaming bands of Witch Elves have begun their murder spree, but gain wind of Taurox’s presence outside. It seems that he is now the guest of honour and the Druchii waste no time in spilling outside the gates to intercept him.

Outcast and living in exile, Jorek Grimm has long resided in the jungles of Lustria, filling his workshop with a constant stream of new inventions with no regard for tradition. And now, he aims to steal Thorek's quarry out from under him! If the artefacts of the Ancestors are to finally be reforged, this meddlesome upstart must be dealt with. It is time for the old ways to be proven superior once and for all.

Having voyaged through the world in search of the long-lost Artefacts spoken of in the Dammaz Kron, Thorek has finally uncovered the door to the greatest relic site of all. He has arrived just in the nick of time – the blasted Skaven have already arrived and are forcing their way into the vault, eager to pilfer whatever they can find inside. To claim what is rightfully the Dawi’s, Thorek must dispatch these rats, and quickly. Further chittering echoes through the surrounding caves, so they are likely not alone.

Driven by his staunch resolve, Oxyotl has shadowed Taurox right into the centre of the Heart of the Dark. It is an infernal place that has haunted his visions, where few souls other than the Beastmen come. Those not of the Cloven Ones that do usually die a sacrificial death, fed into the gaping maw at the great Herdstone’s base. Fell energies saturate the air, a portent that Chaos’ foul plan is on the verge of fruition with the Brass Bull at the heart of it. It is time to end his rampages once and for all.

Oxyotl arrives at the Dark Elf trading post ahead of his ill-fated, Chaos-worshipping enemies, intent on obliterating the Chaos artefact infecting the Norscan warmbloods. The Northmen approach, likely expecting to meet with the slave traders from Ghrond once again to receive more foul relics, an outcome the Chameleon Skink has already ensured will not come to pass. He must now send a message that there will always be consequences for those who worship the Dark Gods and handle their tainted goods. A hail of deadly darts awaits!

The Witch King desires the power contained within the Shrine of Ultimate Darkness, and what Malekith wants, he usually gets, Ulthuan’s destruction aside... For their part, the Chaos Gods know full well what the Witch King plans and so send their mortal followers to thwart him.\\n\\nThe forces of Chaos will come thick and fast - such is their desperate need to please their malignant Gods!

The Asur, led by Tyrion, have foolishly blocked the Witch King’s path to the volcano and his objective: the Shrine of Vaul. They are not alone, however, as scouts report that Teclis has arrived to support his brother. Taking advantage of the situation, Malekith orders his expendable vanguard to take the brunt of Tyrion’s army, pinning down the enemy and paving the way for victory.

The Witch King has come upon the Mosquito Swamps and sees that they are guarded by Lizardmen. The reptiles are an annoyance that must be fought if Malekith is to claim back his Spellshield. He calls out to the Dark Elves Captain Strenious has hidden to ambush him, telling them that they will now work for him or face his wrath. It is now the Lizardmen that face an ambush.

The walls of Arnheim offend the Dark Elves with their pure and wholesome tone. It is time to rip them down, and kill whoever is on the other side! Some will need to be taken alive, of course. Should the colony be taken the High Elf defenders are under no illusion as to what their fates will be, and so prepare to fight like trapped vermin!

While the Witch King himself is absent from the initial attack of Vaul’s Anvil, he sends forth his best to deal with Teclis. The volcano rages all around, as if it knows that battle is inevitable. Teclis has sent word to his brother, but has no notion where Tyrion is or if he will even answer the summons. And so the High Loremaster must face the forces of the Witch King alone, but he is not afraid, for he is Teclis, Defender of Ulthuan!

The ratmen step from the shadows, one wearing the War Crown at a jaunty angle to deliberately mock the High Elves. Whether the creatures were in league with Terrorgheist all along, or are just rampant opportunists, it does not matter. What is far more important is that the War Crown is returned to its rightful owner. The Skaven may have Teclis and his host surrounded, but the ratmen must now deal with one of the most powerful mages to ever have lived!

The Dark Elves attack at Vaul’s Anvil, confident that they can rid the world of one of the greatest threats to their power. But the volcano is not the best battlefield for the attacker - its narrow confines mean the advantage is with the defender. Although, an enemy as desperate as the Druchii will not think twice before committing sufficient numbers to ensure Tyrion’s defeat!

The Elves have a saying that once a sword is drawn then it should not be sheathed again until the offender’s blood is spilt. Tyrion finds himself accused of Dark Elf sympathies by the Loremasters - it matters little that this situation has been brought about by the intrigues of selfish princes jealous of Tyrion’s influence over the Phoenix King. For now, swords have been drawn and blood must indeed be spilt! Tyrion must expect to face powerful magic and ranks of elite Swordmasters.

With Kroq-Gar’s legions hissing, fierce and ready, it is time to march on the Fallen Gates. The Elf servants have blasphemed not just by leaving Ulthuan, but by daring to interfere with the Cosmic Gates - an ancient device that can open a portal into the Realm of Chaos. For such a heinous transgression, the Elves must be punished as decreed by the Lord of Solar-City. The gates are surrounded by a deep crevasse that must be crossed before the Asur are truly engaged. The trespassers will try to stop Kroq-Gar, but that is their mistake to make!

Dark Elves block the way to the Well of Time. The fissure within, from which Tlanxla reaches out across the eons, will only remain open for so long, so Kroq-Gar must act quickly to vanquish the threat. However, the terrain is far from an open field and the Elves are notoriously cunning and difficult to bring to battle!

The Skaven dare trespass on the Isle of the Crimson Skull, a place the Old Ones themselves once thought a haven. The ratmen must be destroyed and the Cobra Mace reclaimed, but the Skink attendants note caution as the Skaven have hauled large catapults ashore, giving them considerable firepower. They have no consideration for the safety of their countless underlings - as well as being armed to the teeth, the Skaven are also willing to sacrifice their slaves whilst their artillery is brought to bear. The Lizardmen must also be wary, for the Rat-spawn are the sneakiest of tricksters in this world and will almost certainly attempt to outflank their Saurus warriors in a most underhand way!

The ancient enemy, or their mortal servants, have come to the Fallen Gates to stop their activation. Lord Mazdamundi must defend the Gates at all costs. A chasm separates the two armies; the most ancient of Slann would do well to use this as an advantage but beware the enemy’s flying minions.

The Dwarfs are ambushing! If they know they have been manipulated by Grand Warlord Gnawdwell as merely tools to test Queek, they care not. For they despise Headtaker more than any other thaggoraki! A chance to slay an enemy who features prominently in the Great Book of Grudges is not one the Dawi are willing to pass up. The ambush begins!

While the eyes of Men struggle with fighting underground, the Skaven excel, and it is in this warren that Queek will have his vengeance over the ratman that has taunted him many times. The boaster’s armour will be Queek's property! But a note of caution… this enemy has proven tricksy from the start - as the hordes meet in battle, no doubt further traps will have been set!

The Plaguelord has come to the Isle of the Crimson Skull in search of a rare mineral; the unholy Skull that dominates this place will restore the Rod of Corruption. But the Lizardmen are aware of Skrolk’s movements and have been tracking their nemesis since his recent slaughter of their spawn-kin. The time for inaction is over. The isle is a sacred place, for the Old Ones once roamed there. To let the Rat-spawn enter the island’s interior is unthinkable, so the foes meet upon the beach…

Skrolk enters the mortuary and is immediately suspicious, for the foetid air stinks of Dark Magic yet is unfamiliar to him. He sends his horde forth and they scamper around the bloated corpses of the Man-things, towards the Liber Bubonicus. But then the corpses start to stir, and rise to fight once again. Some ancient reptilian enchantment has been activated, and now Skrolk must fight those he has already killed!

The Lizardmen assemble behind Nakai — a powerful spirit of the Lustrian jungle made flesh — appearing from the fog like furious spectres of vengeance. They seek to relieve Rakarth of his newly-acquired creatures, and free them to return to the jungles from which they were taken. Ambushing the Black Ark, they gather in numbers, fearless under the leadership of their revered general. Now Rakarth must defend his prize, and lay waste to the Lizardmen army, sending a clear message to all who would think to stand between him and his monstrous treasures.

The hollow pretenders of the other Ruinous Powers seek to claim what rightfully belongs to Slaanesh: a decadent feast of souls! Readying his forces, Azazel revels in the chance to punish their ambition, for he stands on the precipice of eternal glory, and none shall rob him of it. Delivering such a prize would surely secure his place as the Prince of Pleasure's ecstatic right hand, and only the false champions that challenge him stand in his way. It is well past time they were eliminated!

By Morathi’s machinations, Azazel has travelled to the Realm of Slaanesh with slaughterous intent. The Dark Prince’s second-in-command is unaccustomed to being a pawn in the plans of others, yet the opportunity to reap Elven souls is not something any acolyte of the Dark Gods would pass up. Besides, the aloof Prince of Damnation cannot help but be impressed by the lengths the Hag Queen has gone to for such a worthy sacrifice to the God of Excess. The Prince of Damnation will gladly make the final kill – a feast of souls awaits!

Rivals bearing the banners of the other Ruinous Powers stake their claim on the Altar of Battle. Festus can only laugh at their hubris, for he is sure they will soon languish in suffering and sickness, succumbing to defeat as he alone claims the coveted prize of the arena. Battle will decide the victor of Zanbaijin and to such a champion will go all of its rotten spoils! Nurgle will soon gorge upon a wealth of souls, Festus is determined to make sure of it!

With scalpel in hand and receptacle upon his back, Festus has gleefully headed into Nurgle’s corner of the Chaos Realm in search of tidbits to liven up his plagues. As he shuffles between noisome fungoid and carnivorous vine, a delightful sight marauds into view – a rambunctious Brayherd of lost (but very angry) Beastmen. It not only has Cygors in its ranks – creatures whose cycloptic, magic-seeing eyes Festus has long sought to harvest – but also Jabberslythes, whose vitriolic bile will have myriad uses in his foul alchemy. This will be quite the autopsy!

Glorious bloodshed awaits, as the divided forces of Chaos gather in their quest to secure the Arena's most valuable reward. The Altar of Battle stands proudly at the heart of Zanbaijin, housing the souls of those slain in their attempt to claim it. Their failure shall be Valkia's victory. Called to the arena in the Blood God's name, she must now lay waste to all her challengers and claim her place as Zanbaijin's champion in eternity. The Altar shall be hers for the taking!

Stepping out of the bloodless reality of the mortal world into the eternal twilight of the Chaos Realm, Valkia immediately realises why her Master has summoned her. Before her, two hosts of the most noisome races to infest the world prepare for glorious conflict. What brought them there is of little consequence, but what is certain is that the Gorequeen must once again be the weapon Khorne had forged her to be. It matters not why the blood flows – only that it flows!

Fate is in flux and Vilitch's destiny hangs in the balance! The challengers of the arena ready themselves for combat, desiring to claim the Altar of Battle and the lavish supply of souls at its heart. To secure such a bounty for Tzeentch would surely elevate the Master of Misrule as the Changer's greatest champion. Yet the stirrings of a vision tug at Vilitch's mind — a warning of great danger — for another unforeseen power may yet desire the Altar's prize for his own!

Called upon by a Herald of Tzeentch with little warning or explanation, Vilitch has travelled to the Fields of Eternity to answer the summons of the Raven God. Yet upon his arrival, another portal has manifested, from which the dazed forces of the Empire and the East spill forth. These pathetic mortals must be eradicated in Tzeentch's name, for his plotting has changed their fates forever, and each one of them is surely destined to die by the Curseling's hand.

Your fusion of Dwarfen engineering and Daemonic sorcery as an abomination of the worst kind has led the Dwarfs of the west to send a throng against you. How fitting that the Dwari-Thagi march themselves to their own sacrifice to the Father, in turn bringing you one step closer to the revelation and desecration of the relics they hold so dear!

The Ancestor God Grimnir long ago ventured north into the Chaos Wastes. That fool was lost, alone and out of his depth, dropping trinkets as he passed through the Eternal Lagoon. We must search for them deep within the underground pools!

The Ancestor God Grungni was known for his abilities as a miner and blacksmith. In fact, he left behind a mining relic for those weak Dawi of the Grey Mountains. They're struggling to keep their numbers up, and so rely solely on it. We must dig down and steal it from them!

The Ancestor Goddess Valaya helped found many Dwarfholds, her healing brews giving strength to the weak Dawi who dwell there. Now, the Ogres have stolen some of her salves from a nearby Dwarfhold and are feeding it to their god, the Great Maw! We must take it back from those greedy brutes at once!

The ancient Sorcerer-Prophet Astragoth Ironhand is no naive player in the power-games of Zharr-Naggrund, or else he would have been deposed long ago. He has leveraged an unbreakable agreement, in that should a particularly valuable convoy reach its destination unmolested, then he will be awarded the Black Hammer of Hashut and therefore cement his prominence in the Tower of Zharr-Naggrund. The latest mobilisation of Astragoth’s forces is timely, for danger now closes in.

No matter the cause, if left unattended the threat of the Undead will grow – already Vampires and Necromancers flock to the horde, eager to take control. The Legion of Azgorh must act quickly, and so Drazhoath moves to cut the Undead down before they can fully assemble their army.

Now the Great Drill is complete, it is time for the Dhrath-Zharr to break through and take what we're owed for our dedication to the Father of Darkness! We must begin the drilling process and prepare to harvest the Blood of Hashut. The weak Dwarfs of the west will *not* stand in our way!

It appears that the uprising at the refinery is more organised – and has far greater numbers – than was initially reported. Much more noteworthy is that it is led by a particularly hard and militaristic Black Orc. It seems the Dawi-Zharr’s own creation has come back to take his revenge! Luckily, Zhatan is not so easily swayed by such a foe, which is precisely why the Conclave chose him to tidy up this unruly mess.

At last, the final ritual has begun, destined to advance the power of the Great Compass and assure the continued dominance of Cathay. Yet an ancient rivalry threatens the achievement; the armies of the Old One's march on Wei-Jin, ready to halt the ritual by force before their precious Great Plan can be subverted. In response, Yuan Bo has rallied his own men. He will defend the city at all cost, for the ritual must be completed if the rule of the Dragons is ever to be secured.

Yuan Bo sends forth his eyes and ears, using the considerable talents of the agents under his command to pinpoint those responsible for the desecration of Cathayan land and life. The signs are indisputable, a Daemon Prince of Nurgle is responsible for these heinous crimes, but it cannot be acting alone.\\n\\nA trio of alchemists, absent from their posts, have been confirmed as the collaborators. The Jade Dragon has long suspected these unsanctioned practitioners of magic, willing as they are to flout the laws of the realm. They flee before their rightful justice, retreating with their new master through a gateway to the hideous realm of Nurgle.

A wretched Death Hag has lured Mother Ostankya out with the promise of power, but any witch knows better than to trust the word of her own kind. The Coven thinks they have Ostankya trapped, each hoping to take a piece of the Hag Mother's magic for themselves. Yet, Ostankya has other plans...\\n\\nAs the sisters attack, flanked by an army of thralls, the Hag Mother will meet them with glee. It is time to eliminate this treacherous Coven, for the power they wield will soon be Ostankya's alone!

Disease and pestilence sully the land; peasants have begun to fall sick in nearby villages, and chatter of ill-looking vermin can be heard in every town. What lies below? What foul presence dares trespass on these lands? There is only one way to find out…\\n\\nOstankya has sought out the source of this plague, finding a nest of diseased Skaven, basking in their own filth. They must be shown that their incursion is unwelcome. Yet something tells Ostankya the true root of this malevolence has yet to rear its head...

The Wood Elves have made their disapproval of Ostankya's methods known. Unwilling to have her Dark Magic breach the sanctity of their land, they stand in staunch opposition to her ways, ready to fight to the death to keep her from channelling the Spirit Essence that lies within their woodland. So, it is death that Ostankya shall give them. The evil and malevolent spirits of the forest will heed the witch's call; with their aid, these foolish guardians must be cast aside for ever daring to bar the Hag Mother's path.

For too long has the world been subjected to filth and corruption. The land crumbles into decay, with putrescence and disease slowly leeching the life from every field, farm and village. As protector of the land, Mother Ostankya will suffer the trespass of corruption no longer. Having initiated the Malediction of Ruin, she must hold firm against the oncoming hordes of darkness until the ritual is finally complete. As enemies swarm the capital like flies, all hope of victory relies upon the Malediction of Ruin's earth-shattering power finally being released.

The graves of Sylvania are rife with the wandering Undead, where wraiths and rotten corpses pose a constant threat to the unwary. It is rare that one would seek them out, yet Mother Ostankya remains unphased by the armies of Undeath. Her plan for these ghastly creatures is clear: slay the foul hordes to set their spirits free. Once their souls roam untethered, they can finally be broken, forced and enthralled into her service as soldiers in an army of ghosts.

The spirits of the old land have revealed a great power to Ostankya, but alas, her prize is under threat: a Black Ark has been spotted nearby – Dark Elves from Naggaroth searching for new beasts to tame. They have already made their way inland and are dangerously close to the crystals she has come to harvest – or perhaps the cave harbours something else that they desire? Having foreseen her opposition, Mother Ostankya knows she must beat them to the cave in the mountains at all costs to claim the crystal before their meddling ruins her plans.

Aekold Helbrass, the once-great Knight of the Brethren of the Golden Eagle, is on a path to Chaos – though whether it is his choice to follow this path, or Tzeentch who has set him upon it, is known only to the Master of Fate Himself. One final step remains to complete his journey, monstrous odds stacked against him that must be overcome. Your Warriors of Tzeentch rally around this unlikely hero, but it will surely be the strength of your host that will sway the tide of victory against the Doombull.

Feeding upon the greed of men and Dwarfs, the Changeling has played two groups of merchants effortlessly in orchestration of a bloodbath, simply because he can. This has gone better than he could have imagined – the Dwarfs are not the only ones preparing to take up arms within Karak Azgaraz, but also other heavily-armed merchants of the nations of men. In a whimsical moment of playfulness, the Changeling has let the details of his ruse become known to Dwarf messengers, and they are already on their way to the Hold. If they manage to deliver the news before being put to slaughter, this could be quite the battle!

Working insidious sorcery, the Changeling's spellcasting hordes aim to rob the Tomb Kings of their sacred monument, sowing Chaos and carnage in abundance. Weaving their magic upon the Black Pyramid, the whole structure will be lifted into the skies and re-settled in foreign lands. Yet such a trick will be no easy feat. To work their mischief, the Sorcerers must be protected against the oncoming hordes of death, until the Black Pyramid has been ripped clean from the earth.

The Bretonnian Knights ride forth, hoping to halt the armies of Tzeentch and end the Chaos wracking their homeland. The Changeling, of course, has other plans. Slaying the opposing forces would leave the path wide open to the vast crypts beneath the so-called Land of Chivalry, gifting Mousillon's Necromancers with a near endless army of Undead at their disposal. As it stands, the fabled Green Knight of Bretonnia is all that preserves the defenders' resolve...

The endless feud between the Ruinous Powers is nothing if not amusing for Tzeentch, for the more they bitterly struggle for power, the more easily the Changeling's schemes go unnoticed. Their latest prank has only exacerbated tensions in the Chaos Wastes; with the forces of Khorne and Slaanesh summoned to the realm of Nurgle, the squabbling has only just begun! As all set their gaze upon the Changeling's army, so too does the Architect of Fate, casting His eye above the battlefield to aid in the torment of His enemies.

Rebellion has long been brewing amongst the labour camps of the Dark Lands, where the Black Orcs begin to rally against the tyranny of their greedy mountain masters. The workers are fortunate that the Changeling is nothing if not a champion of freedom, gladly aiding in their uprising out of the unkindness of his heart... And if Chaos swallows the region whole, killing servant and master alike? Well, such is the price of liberty. At the very least, Tzeentch will surely delight in the pandemonium of battle.

With the planning of an Imperial summit underway, the Changeling pounced on the opportunity to sow the seeds of dissension across the Empire. Having deceived the delegate from Altdorf into arriving late, the forces of Tzeentch have the chance to ambush the other delegates at their meeting place, with the forces from Altdorf nowhere to be seen. Once their leaders flee, they will have no choice but to assume the treachery of their imperial ally. By the time the warriors of Altdorf arrive, the damage to their reputation will have already been done!

With a hollow heart and a mind for mischief, the Changeling relishes the chance to see Cathay fall to Ruin, guiding a Skaven Warlock Engineer to the very base of the Grand Bastion. The structure's magical protections will matter little with such a beast burrowing beneath it! Yet, the armies of the Dragon will stop at nothing to halt its progress. The Changeling's success hinges on defending the Skaven beast until its work is done – only then will the Gates of the Grand Bastion crumble, and the whole of Cathay lie exposed.

The challenge has been issued and – as predicted – Wulfrik the Wanderer rides out to meet it. With the Norscan forces lured to battle, the Changeling's devious plan is set in motion. The savage hordes of the north need only be weakened, for once the Raven's spellcasters have worked their magic, Wulfrik and his barbarian tribes will be teleported away to wreak havoc across the land. The Changeling may simply point him at a target and watch the Chaos commence!

The Changeling's armies sweep out against the Lizardmen, throwing their soldiers into disarray. As a result, the Plaque of Sotek they were transporting lies almost ripe for the taking! Should the Trickster seize it, the Great Plan could be entirely re-written – by the insidious rats of Clan Pestilens no less – dragging the Cold Ones' entire society into discord. The Lizardmen will not let such a sacred artefact be stolen without a fight, however. If there is any hope of claiming the Plaque, the savage reptilian warriors that guard it must first be put to the slaughter.

The Dark Elves would let their slaves rot within their towering Black Arks, however the Changeling foresees a different fate for the wretches. With the forces of Naggaroth backed against their floating fortresses, their full attention is sure to be on the warriors of Tzeentch before them. So distracted, they will never expect their own slaves to attack while their backs are turned. Transformed into grotesque Bloated Corpses, they will sink the Dark Elves' once mighty fleet, and swallow the forces of their former masters whole!

Wielding the twisted sorcery of Tzeentch, the Changeling's forces have charged the Great Vortex of Ulthuan, slowly tainting its magic with the corruption of Slaanesh. Though the High Elves hope to put an end to the scheme, Tzeentch's Trickster will delight in holding them back until the vortex is engulfed in the malevolent energies of Ruin. Should the spellcasters succeed, all of Ulthuan will be swamped in the Prince of Pleasure's corruption. As such, perhaps the Dark Prince will send the Changeling allies, to ensure his meddling succeeds.

Finally, the greatest prank of all is at hand; Tzeentch's throne lies bare, simply begging for a worthy Trickster to sneak in and take a seat. The Changeling will not miss such a delightful opportunity! With the aid of a teleporting ritual, he must reach the Impossible Fortress, obscured from his master's gaze. Though waves of oncoming warriors will no doubt try to stall the spell, their attack must be held off if Tzeentch's Trickster is ever to sit upon the unholy throne.

It is Geheimnisnacht Eve, when the twin moons of Morrslieb and Mannslieb are high in the night sky and the veil between the planes of existence is thin. That well-known Dwarf Slayer of legend, Gotrek, and his chronicler companion Felix Jaeger have exposed and dealt with an exceptionally vile cult of Slaanesh at the heart of the Empire. Suddenly, on this evening of mystery, they find themselves transported through a portal gate to the Prince of Pleasure's hedonistic realm...

Malakai Makaisson is attempting a daring rescue of a young Master Engineer and his regiment from a Dark Elf slave camp that holds captive men as well as Dwarfs. The Slayer-Engineer’s oath to defend human allies means reinforcements from the Empire will fight alongside him, though he certainly needs little help or encouragement to fight slavers, and even less to punish the Dark Elves for oppressing his kin! Then afterwards, perhaps an opportunity to find out if this savvy, would-be tinkerer is in need of gainful employment.

No longer shall the Draconic mounts of the haughty Dragon Princes wreak devastation upon the innocent – Malakai Makaisson must settle the score or die trying. Dragonriders rally in defence of the beast he has come to slay and the others that accompany it, but Makaisson remains unmoved. Bringing his mighty Cannons to bear upon the Dragons' lair hidden in the mountains, the Slayer-Engineer marches forth to seek redemption through glorious battle!

As the earth shakes with the booming movements of Dreadquakes in the distance, Malakai Makaisson waves his Gyrocopters into the skies. The Sorcerer-Prophet he must defeat wields twisted strands of Chaos Magic, commanding his war machines with mystical acuity. Yet Malakai is just as determined to prove the superiority of his own engineering. Either he shows the Dark Dwarfs that their infernal mechanics are little more than toys next to Dawi designs, or he finally meets his doom!

An Exalted Bloodthirster pledged to the Lord of Murder exists only to stain its hands with the blood of innocents – but no more! Malakai Makaisson marches to rain fire upon the beast and its infernal army, his Organ Guns calibrated to tear through the Daemonic flesh of the Khornate scourge. Heralded by the echo of ordnance, the Slayer-Engineer will show the God of Murder that this world will not fall to any Chaos God's desires without a fight, or may doom find him first!

Glory and adventure await in the darkest depths of the forest where a twisted Ancient Treeman gathers a host for the tumult of battle. Malakai Makaisson races out to quiet the fury of the forest before the kingdoms of Men are overwhelmed by a tide of wood and bark. With him he brings the full power of his custom Flame Cannons to bear upon the woods, where the malevolent trees will soon be piles of ashes.

The grobi menace has descended into the Arachnarok Queen’s lair with little care, eager to wrangle her eight-legged brood and claim the eggs for their own. Yet Malakai Makaisson is in hot pursuit with just as much reckless abandon, the call of battle ringing out from the world's depths promising glory or doom. With the ferocious Goblin Hewer in tow, the crowds of enemies that await below the earth will soon come to understand the might of cutting-edge Dawi engineering!

A horde of Undead thralls has been risen from the earth, controlled by the Dark Magic of a Vampire Lord. Malakai Makaisson has caught up to the spineless cur, who hides behind the powerful Necromancers at his command. With a fleet of Gyrobombers awaiting orders, Malakai marches into the Vampire Lord's corrupted lands to dispatch the henchmen and send the Undead masses to their doom... or meet his own!

A deadly Warpstone Bomb sits precariously among the high peaks, surrounded by a tide of Skaven eager to see the destruction of a nearby Dawi Hold. Racing against time, Malakai Makaisson has brought his army to bear upon the threat, with a fleet of awestriking Thunderbarges in tow. As time ticks onward, he can only hope his forces will handle the verminous wretches that block his path, for the bomb must be dismantled before disaster can strike!

Elspeth von Draken marches against time! As a town burns, its citizens suffer in the malevolent clutches of Chaos, dragged from their homes to serve as a bloody sacrifice. Though each dark ritual threatens to call forth a Daemonic tide into the very heart of the Empire, each death keeps the sands of Death's Timekeeper flowing. If these converging Winds of Shyish are to be harnessed, the rampaging forces of Chaos must first be laid to waste.

The Nemesis Crown plants the seeds of its wicked corruption across the land, spreading destruction at its bearer's behest. The Night Goblin making use of its dark power leaves nothing but death in his wake, and the rampaging army that marches at his command poses untold danger to the Empire. Elspeth will not stand for it! Leading her own army into battle, she is resolved to halt this savage menace, and destroy the Nemesis Crown's malevolent power once and for all.

When Alaric the Mad crafted the Master Rune of Ages, he hoped it would give the Dawi a chance to master their own fate. Yet set within the Nemesis Crown, the rune became a beacon of malice, sending its bearer on a rampage of murder and destruction. When the Night Goblins unearthed its evil, they too uncovered Alaric's shame; now Malakai cannot allow word of this failure to spread! His army races to defeat the grobi menace – only then will be buried forevermore.

A horde of Night Goblins control the Nemesis Crown, an artefact of such wicked destructive power that it inspires even the Maggot Lord to envy. Tamurkhan has set his sights on the foul creation, urging his armies into action to meet the Crown-bearer with force. Once those pesky Night Goblins have been put to slaughter, the Crown will finally rest atop a worthy head, fuelling Tamurkhan's conquest and dealing the grimmest of deaths in the Urfather's name.

Ever diligent in his service to Nurgle, the chosen Tallyman has tracked a plagued High Elf army all the way to the very gates of the White Tower. However, also on the approach is a Prophetess of Bretonnia, an ally to the Asur, intent on using her purifying magic to cleanse the High Elves and rescue Ulthuan from Nurgle’s all-encompassing embrace. Epidemius, unswayable in his intent for close observation and record-keeping, must see to the High Elves’ deaths from close range, while also staving off the approaching Bretonnians for as long as possible.

Ancient wisdom foretells that a gift of wild magic awaits any Chaos Lord capable of surviving Hexensnacht in the dark and foreboding forests haunted by the Beastmen. Tamurkhan sets up camp amidst the trees, eager to put the legend to the test, and soon the beastly savages descend. If the aid of the mountain's magic is ever to be attained, Tamurkhan must survive the sudden onslaught and soak the forest soil in Beastman blood.

The land is littered with Chaos Dwarf corpses, as a rogue idol of magic and rock rampages across the battlefield. Empowered by Goblin Shamans, the creature will be near impossible to bring down, thus the magical Greenskin miscreants will be the first of Tamurkhan's targets. Once they have been slain, the idol will be vulnerable, presenting the Maggot Lord the chance to save these unfortunate Dark Dwarfs, and revel in them bowing at his feet.

{{tr:land_units_onscreen_name_wh3_dlc25_nur_cha_exalted_hero_chieftain}} harbours an enmity with a ruthless and powerful Chaos champion whose warband has been encountered in the Wastes. Khargan’s pride will not allow this rival’s warband to pass in peace, and therefore the carnage of battle is the only solution! Once enough blood has been spilled, someone will be forced to bow, and the victor will earn a new and infernal fealty… Although when two armies of Chaos meet, mutual destruction is inevitable.

Haunted by nightmarish visions of Nurgle's destruction, Tamurkhan has been summoned to the Realm of Decay through the mysterious magicks of Ketzak Fimdirach. The Fimir transports Tamurkhan to Nurgle's garden, where he must fend off the invading hordes that aim to devastate the Urfather's unholy dominion. As waves of attacking Daemons approach, Tamurkhan leads his festering host to end this incursion, dooming every foolish enemy of the Lord of Pestilence to a vile and putrid end.

Fatsod, a Great Unclean One blessed with gargantuan proportions and even greater appetites, has taken to devouring the faithful from among Nurgle's warbands to sate its own endless hunger. The Chieftains cannot afford to lose so many troops at such an alarming rate! Taking decisive action, Tamurkhan turns his armies against the unclean monstrosity; it is time to put an end to this glorious, unholy feast, if only for the sake of Nurgle and His armies.

The powerful arcane Winds have driven the Jabberslythe, Skraelsbane, into the throes of insanity, slaughtering the Skin Wolves of Norsca with every ounce of volatile magic thrumming through its being. As Tamurkhan races to confront the creature, he finds Mournhowl eager to wage war against it, seeking retribution for his devoured kin. With the malevolent forces of the Master of Hosts standing beside Mournhowl and his vengeful army, the rogue Jabberslythe faces a terrifying, united front.

Arriving at the enormous iron Gates of Nuln, it soon becomes apparent to Tamurkhan that he was expected, for the Empire have traded territory, buying themselves time to dig in and prepare defences with which to face the Nurglish onslaught to come. The finest, most powerful array of Imperial weaponry is lined up to rain down a chorus of gunpowder and hellfire. From the common footsoldier to the elite, all are poised to lay down their lives for the Jewel of the Empire.

Gorbad has ordered the forests in the way of his Greenskin horde to be harvested for wood to construct more war machines. A Beastmen tribe just so happens to have ancient Blood-grounds nearby, however, and Ironclaw’s scouts speak of powerful Treemen known to call this place home. Such is both groups’ disdain for Gorbad’s ecocidal activities that both have timed an opportunistic attack to take him down. But they are not cooperating with one another, giving the wily Warboss a potential advantage in an otherwise unfavourable battle.

Murdering the risen dead poses an interesting conundrum to Arbaal – and hopefully, a challenge that would not disappoint his master. For if there is something the Blood God hates more than the Vampires’ oft-clandestine ways, it is the fact they are prodigal users of magic. It is not unexpected that Arbaal has chosen to mobilise against them, his own willpower extending only as far as his need to go to battle in service to Khorne’s whims. The Destroyer delivers death in equal measure, the kind that even the Undead cannot escape.

Marching upon the craggy trails of the World’s Edge Mountains, Skulltaker heads towards the harvest of his next skull. The Dwarf throng that awaits offers much to the skull-reaping Daemon, but he has also sensed the added incentive of Sigmar’s mortal worshippers who are somewhere nearby and closing in. The Blooded Wanderer gives silent praise to the Blood God for the slaughter to come. To harvest skulls and show his worth are the Skulltaker’s eternal tenets, but the chance to murder in the name of vengeance is a call to battle that no Daemon of Khorne can ignore.

To the annoyance of their Orc employer Gnashrak, Golgfag and his mercenary crew had been slyly snacking on the Greenskins’ ranks of Goblins for quite some time now. Gnashrak’s patience has waned, though he still requires Golgfag to march with him again against the Dwarfs of Karak Kadrin. No longer able to ignore the insolent gluttony of Golgfag and his Ogres, Gnashrak plans this to be their final job for him, and it may not end amicably. For now, at least, Golgfag and Gnashrak march together…

The twin Daemonic axes, Slaughter and Carnage, must be fed before the Brazen Altar to restore them to their former lustre and power.\\n\\nAfter much cautious brokering, an alliance has been formed with two of Skarbrand's brother Bloodthirsters, who have summoned their hosts ready to fight.\\n\\nA Nurgle horde has been lured toward the Altar, a fitting sacrifice... and yet, Khorne cares not from whence the blood flows. The thought of delaying makes Skarbrand seethe. Why wait for slaughter when there are plenty of bodies here?

When the Red Tzar fell from his faithful mount, Urskin, the river waters swept him away, back to the Motherland. And there he has rested ever since, encased in ice. Until now, for Boris Bokha wakes from his hibernation, having heard the death-roar of Ursun.\\n\\nHowever, the Great Enemy is quick to act. Tzeentch's minions surround the ice, weaving a powerful spell to weaken the Motherland's wards and crack open Boris' frozen casket. The Sorcerers must be toppled from their perches and slain before their spell is complete.

The Crystal Cloak once belonged to the Khan-Queens before it was stolen away by the agents of Tzeentch. It now lies at the centre of the Fractal Maze. The crystalline walls channel magic at the cloak to fray it, and thus reveal the power Tzeentch requires to merge crystal and ice – linking his realm to the Motherland. Katarin must act quickly to reclaim the cloak!

When the Red Tzar fell from his faithful mount, Urskin, the river waters swept him away, back to the Motherland. And there he has rested ever since, encased in ice. Until now, for Boris Bokha wakes from his hibernation, having heard the death-roar of Ursun.\\n\\nHowever, the Great Enemy is quick to act. Tzeentch's minions surround the ice, weaving a powerful spell to weaken the Motherland's wards and crack open Boris' frozen casket. The Sorcerers must be toppled from their perches and slain before their spell is complete.

The Dark Elves come looking for slaves, but they shall not take Ursun's flock! The Burning Brazier, wielded by Kostaltyn has only smouldered of late, but the hatred of these interlopers shall kindle the flame to brightness once more!\\n\\nRushing headlong into Dark Elf bolts will not serve Ursun, defend and then unleash righteous fury when the time is right. Be wary, for the Black Arks of the Druchii carry many crew, scouting parties have come ashore at several points but now prey has been spotted they will converge on the Kislevites from several directions.

The Dwarfs and their almost impervious constitutions have always frustrated the Plaguefather. It has also proven difficult to collect enough bearded specimens to experiment on, for they are wont to fight back and inconsiderate enough to prefer dying in battle and rage rather than meekly waiting to be collected.\\n\\nNow, there is an opportunity – deep under the ground in what the mortals call "the Underway", Ku'gath shall suppress their iron will with a vile effluvium that will not be dissipated in the open air. But even before it is released, the Dwarfs' spirit must be defeated and crushed in battle. They will fight hard, for they don't like trespassers in their caves. Expect them to send for reinforcements.

The Overtyrant's Crown lacks its distinctive gleam of late, due to the incursion of the Black Orc Boss who dares to claim the Mountains of Mourn for himself. He needs to be crushed, his skull stamped hard into the ash on the mountainside of the Fire Mouth. Then the crown will shine up real good.\\n\\nBut this Orc is cunning, one of the reasons he has grown to become such a threat. He surrounds himself with Goblins so he may cast them into battle caring not of their fate while keeping his boys back to do the real damage...

The hunt is on, as Skrag's cauldron is all but empty – freshly slaughtered meat shall fill it back up and so the Great Maw can more easily commune with His prophet.\\n\\nInto the snowy peaks, Skrag has been led on a trail by his hungry Gorgers. But now, as the Ogre-ghouls recede to the mountain sides, Skrag spies red glimmering eyes and malign squeaks from in front and behind him. Skrag is surrounded... the Prophet is delighted! The vermin think they have him in a trap...

It was into the Sea of Dreams that N'Kari was cast when he fought Tyrion and Teclis at the Shrine of Asuryan. There, as he wallowed in the depths, despairing of his defeat, he lost the Daemonic blade given to him by the Dark Prince. Now the search has narrowed, the Witstealer Sword is close, but the High Elves – alerted by their arcane wards – have already sent a host to guard its location and prevent their hated enemy from being reunited with his beloved blade.\\n\\nN'Kari must not waste time tormenting his foes, but break through the choke points and slay any that stand in his way, so he alone can claim the sword.

Time has fractured. Kairos' power to scry all of the past and the days yet to be is in peril, leaving him blind to all of fate. He must recalibrate the Staff of Tomorrow by asserting himself against his future and former self.\\n\\nUpon this battlefield, reality has shattered and the past guards what is known in the centre of the isle, but beware, for the future does not always come to the fore.

Great black walls of glass line steep passes, reflecting the unfolding madness of war. Unbeknownst to the mortals who die here, Tzeentch has long had an interest in Black Fire Pass, a constricting battlefield where odds are overcome, fates are fulfilled, and unpredicted possibilities come to fruition. Enter this bottleneck of bloodshed and face a twisted reflection of the beast within.

From the Dark to the Light, it is only through the omnipotence of the Wind-lord that all forms of arcane power exist. When the essence of Chaos rained down and saturated the soil during the First Coming, it gifted the potential for animus to the buried dead forevermore. The puppeteer of puppeteers now manifests Hel Fenn to test your mettle against an unending host of the night.

Their existence a fable to most mortals, the Old Ones’ meddling forays between realities led them to face the greatest powers of all, against which they had little defence, save for their futile creations. In the shadow of the Fallen Gates, you will be tested unto death against the First – creatures steeled by the greatest proof of the Old Ones’ existence.

Foolish mortals so easily confuse ultimate darkness for ultimate power when it dangles like a poisonous, unpicked apple enticing their desires. Those who covet such things may think it the means to Chaos’ demise, but often it is to the contrary. Battle is as much nourishment for Tzeentch as it is for the other gods – endure the Everchosen’s aggressions and receive the Altar’s boons.

Enter my master’s domain, aspirant, and endure the twisted horrors of the Sorcerer’s Realm. The obstacles and traps created by His mortal mind await the doomed souls who seek passage into the Impossible Fortress, but things will be simpler for you. The Fateweaver, mighty Lord of Change, hindsight and foresight manifest, provides your challenge and carries your prize. Tzeentch’s slaughter-fields beckon.

The Brazen Altar lies in the heart of the Chaos Wastes. Some claim it was built by Khorne's followers in defiance of those that created the Howling Citadel. Ever since, it has been a sacred site of the Blood God. Now Yuri Barkov, prince of the Ungols, must approach, for inscribed upon it are the runes to summon the Bridge-Maker. But the Brazen Altar is guarded – even now Khorne sends one of his favoured pets to ensure it will not be defiled.

Yuri's army has crossed the Screaming Chasm and now stands before the Howling Citadel. Within – he is told – is a portal that will take him to the lost Bear-God. But entrance to the Citadel will not go uncontested. The traitor, Boyar Kurnz, guards its entrance with his army of Chaos followers and darker allies. However, Yuri has a boon of his own – for a great price he has made a pact with the Bridge-Maker, an exalted Greater Daemon of Khorne, and a creature that cares not from where the blood flows!

Since leaving the Kislev outpost, Ursun, the Bear-God has spoken to Yuri once more. The Prince of Kislev must enter the Lucent Maze, a devious labyrinth dedicated to Tzeentch. Yuri's force of brave Kislevites must traverse the outskirts of the maze and repulse the Daemons of Tzeentch. Only then can he alone – the paragon of the Bear-God – enter its twisted passages.
